entries.meaning: (linear algebra, of a function in two variables) Linear (preserving linear combinations) in each variable.
examples:
The function 
  
    
      
        f
        (
        x
        ,
        y
        )
        =
        x
        y
      
    
    {\displaystyle f(x,y)=xy}
  
 is bilinear, because 
  
    
      
        f
        (
        a
        x
        +
        b
        u
        ,
        y
        )
        =
        a
        f
        (
        x
        ,
        y
        )
        +
        b
        f
        (
        u
        ,
        y
        )
      
    
    {\displaystyle f(ax+bu,y)=af(x,y)+bf(u,y)}
  
 and 
  
    
      
        f
        (
        x
        ,
        a
        y
        +
        b
        v
        )
        =
        a
        f
        (
        x
        ,
        y
        )
        +
        b
        f
        (
        x
        ,
        v
        )
      
    
    {\displaystyle f(x,ay+bv)=af(x,y)+bf(x,v)}
  
 for all values.

entries.meaning: (complex analysis, physics, engineering) Of or pertaining to a Möbius transformation (type of conformal map representable as the ratio of two linear functions).
